text: you were coming through the cemetery the
train was going it's normal speed very
high speed 60 or 70 miles an hour and it
stopped I want to say suddenly but it
was like a car slipping on ice and just
trying to stop really quickly about ten
minutes later the conductor got in the
intercom and mentioned that the train
hit a car and you know at that point I
knew I knew we were taking this train
home but I can't think anything was that
terrible no no there was no panic I did
install smoke in my car or anything the
mood where I was was more confusion than
anything because we never spelled smokes
and what a time we got the verbal notice
or smoke and fire we didn't smell
anything so there are actually people
asking open the window open to open the
doors to let us out a couple of
passengers were saying no I'm not open
this window you know I didn't hear
anything that would just cause more
confusion so people are actually
resisting evacuating because they didn't
realize how bad it was and everyone was
very good about getting off very slowly
you know were helped down by responders
I think as a firefighter and then we
just started walking along the train and
it was not until we swing up out of the
Train and we saw the fire a couple of
hardcore ahead that we realized wow this
is a big deal
Oh
